description: This course surveys standard data structures and algorithms with emphasis on implementation
experience and complexity analysis.  Topics include algorithmic strategies, fundamental
computer algorithms, stacks, queues, lists, trees, hash tables, specialized trees (e.g., binary,
AVL, B-trees), heaps and priority queues, compression, and decompression.  Prerequisites:
Computer Science 231 and either Computer Science 125 or 251, or consent of the instructor.
